stack wrote:

>Andy Boyko wrote:
>  
>
> ...

>The basic approach would be some subclass of ARCReader that took a list 
>of extractors and arcs to process on the command line.  The extractors 
>would be the refactored guts of current extractors stripped of the 
>crawler context (i.e. no reference to CrawlURIs, etc.  The crawler 
>context references would be in wrappers, just as the ARCWriterProcessor 
>wraps ARCWriter now).  Per extractor, the subclass of ARCReader would 
>reget the ARCRecord till all were done (Or, if more than one, it might 
>pay to add caching if small or use the subclass our netarchive.dk 
>colleagues have been talking of).
>* Pro: Easier delivery
>  
>
The awkward aspect of the above approach will be the code to handle 
conversion from byte stream to character stream (Parsing of HTTP headers 
if present to find content-type to get out encoding, etc).

St.Ack


>
>  
>
